brief_title: Study Of Women With Severe Diarrhea-Predominant Irritable Bowel Syndrome Having Failed Conventional Therapy
brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the safety and effectiveness of different doses of an investigational medication in women with severe diarrhea-predominant Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) who have failed conventional therapy.
criteria: Inclusion Criteria: - Diagnosed with severe diarrhea-predominant Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS). - Failed conventional therapy. - Willing to make daily calls on a touch-tone telephone. Exclusion criteria: - History of or current chronic or severe constipation. - Bloody diarrhea, abdominal pain with rectal bleeding. - Thrombophlebitis. - Abnormal thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) value. - Alcohol and/or substance abuse within past two years. - Pregnant or lactating. - History/treatment of malignancy within past five years.
